poem:
**Slow Motion Unveiled**

In the garden of waning stars,  
a dance like loose consonants  
breaks the silence—  
between the sound of flags folding  
and the swell of unruly words.  
Historians will sift gravel from gold,  
but who will hear the cymbals  
clash in the middle of a meadow—  
scripted chaos and unsung shadows?
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "What if Trump’s campaign is cover for a slow-motion coup? | Jan-Werner Müller Whatever happens next, one day historians will have to explain why a candidate who earlier this year had been presented as disciplined started to veer off into unrestrained racist rhetoric and dancing for 40 minutes to his own playlist. Was it age, as plenty of commentators have speculated? Was it a brilliant attempt to balance dehumanizing attacks on minorities with an effort". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
